title: The matrix algebra
content: The main result of this subsection are the theorems showing that ` ( N Mat R ) ` is a ring (see ~ matring ) and an associative algebra (see ~ matassa ). Additionally, theorems for the identity matrix and transposed matrices are provided.

blocks.name: matmulr
blocks.content: Multiplication in the matrix algebra. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 4-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm matmulr(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(c3, cfv(cmulr, c4)))
  -| wceq(c4, co(c0, cmat, c1))
  -| wceq(c3, co(c1, cmmul, cotp(c0, c0, c0)))
} = {
  eqtr4d(c3, cfv(cmulr, c4), cfv(cmulr, co(co(c1, cfrlm, cxp(c0, c0)), csts, cop(cfv(cmulr, cnx), c3))), wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2)))
  mp1i(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2)), wceq(c3, cfv(cmulr, co(co(c1, cfrlm, cxp(c0, c0)), csts, cop(cfv(cmulr, cnx), c3)))), wa(wcel(co(c1, cfrlm, cxp(c0, c0)), universe), wcel(c3, universe)))
  pm3.2i(wcel(co(c1, cfrlm, cxp(c0, c0)), universe), wcel(c3, universe))
  ovex(c1, cfrlm, cxp(c0, c0))
  ovexi(c3, c1, cmmul, cotp(c0, c0, c0))
  setsid(co(c1, cfrlm, cxp(c0, c0)), universe, c3, universe, cmulr)
  mulrid()
  fveq2d(cmulr, c4, co(co(c1, cfrlm, cxp(c0, c0)), csts, cop(cfv(cmulr, cnx), c3)), wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2)))
  matval(c0, c1, c2, c4, co(c1, cfrlm, cxp(c0, c0)), c3)
  eqid(co(c1, cfrlm, cxp(c0, c0)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm matmulr(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2)‚Üí c3 =(√ó ` c4))
  ‚ä£ c4 =(c0[Mat]c1)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(c1[maMul]< c0, c0, c0 >)
} = {
  eqtr4d(c3, (√ó ` c4), (√ó `((c1[freeLMod](c0 √ó c0))[sSet]<(√ó ` ndx), c3 >)), (c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2))
  mp1i((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2), c3 =(√ó `((c1[freeLMod](c0 √ó c0))[sSet]<(√ó ` ndx), c3 >)), ((c1[freeLMod](c0 √ó c0))‚àà ùïå ‚àß c3 ‚àà ùïå))
  pm3.2i((c1[freeLMod](c0 √ó c0))‚àà ùïå, c3 ‚àà ùïå)
  ovex(c1, cfrlm, (c0 √ó c0))
  ovexi(c3, c1, cmmul, < c0, c0, c0 >)
  setsid((c1[freeLMod](c0 √ó c0)), universe, c3, universe, cmulr)
  mulrid()
  fveq2d(cmulr, c4, ((c1[freeLMod](c0 √ó c0))[sSet]<(√ó ` ndx), c3 >), (c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà c2))
  matval(c0, c1, c2, c4, (c1[freeLMod](c0 √ó c0)), c3)
  eqid((c1[freeLMod](c0 √ó c0)))
}

blocks.name: mamumat1cl
blocks.content: The identity matrix (as operation in maps-to notation) is a matrix. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 2-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm mamumat1cl(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, cxp(c2, c2))))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c3))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, crg))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cur, c3))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(c0g, c3))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpo(s0, s1, c2, c2, cif(c4, c5, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cfn))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, cxp(c2, c2))), wf(c0, cxp(c2, c2), c1))
  sylib(w0, wf(c0, cxp(c2, c2), c1), wral(s0, c2, wral(s1, c2, wcel(cif(c4, c5, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), c1))))
  ralrimivva(s0, s1, c2, c2, w0, wcel(cif(c4, c5, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), c1))
  adantr(w0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(cv(s1), c2)), wcel(cif(c4, c5, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), c1))
  syl(w0, wcel(cif(c4, c5, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), c1), wcel(c3, crg))
  ifcld(c4, c5, c1, wcel(c3, crg), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))
  ringidcl(c3, c4, c1)
  ring0cl(c3, c5, c1)
  fmpt2(s0, s1, c2, c2, cif(c4, c5, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), c1, c0)
  sylancr(w0, wb(wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, cxp(c2, c2))), wf(c0, cxp(c2, c2), c1)), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(cxp(c2, c2), cfn))
  fvexi(c1, cbs, c3)
  syl2anc(w0, wcel(cxp(c2, c2), cfn), wcel(c2, cfn), wcel(c2, cfn))
  xpfi(c2, c2)
  elmapg(c1, universe, cxp(c2, c2), cfn, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm mamumat1cl(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí c0 ‚àà(c1[‚Ü¶](c2 √ó c2)))
  ‚ä£ c1 =(Base ` c3)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c3 ‚àà Ring)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(1r ` c3)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(0 ` c3)
  ‚ä£ c0 =(s0 ‚àà c2, s1 ‚àà c2 ‚Ü¶ if(s0 = s1, c4, c5))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c2 ‚àà Fin)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, c0 ‚àà(c1[‚Ü¶](c2 √ó c2)), (c0 :(c2 √ó c2)‚Üí c1))
  sylib(w0, (c0 :(c2 √ó c2)‚Üí c1), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c2, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c2, if(s0 = s1, c4, c5)‚àà c1)))
  ralrimivva(s0, s1, c2, c2, w0, if(s0 = s1, c4, c5)‚àà c1)
  adantr(w0, (s0 ‚àà c2 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c2), if(s0 = s1, c4, c5)‚àà c1)
  syl(w0, if(s0 = s1, c4, c5)‚àà c1, c3 ‚àà Ring)
  ifcld(c4, c5, c1, c3 ‚àà Ring, s0 = s1)
  ringidcl(c3, c4, c1)
  ring0cl(c3, c5, c1)
  fmpt2(s0, s1, c2, c2, if(s0 = s1, c4, c5), c1, c0)
  sylancr(w0, (c0 ‚àà(c1[‚Ü¶](c2 √ó c2))‚Üî(c0 :(c2 √ó c2)‚Üí c1)), c1 ‚àà ùïå, (c2 √ó c2)‚àà Fin)
  fvexi(c1, cbs, c3)
  syl2anc(w0, (c2 √ó c2)‚àà Fin, c2 ‚àà Fin, c2 ‚àà Fin)
  xpfi(c2, c2)
  elmapg(c1, universe, (c2 √ó c2), cfn, c0)
}

blocks.name: mat1comp
blocks.content: The components of the identity matrix (as operation in maps-to notation). (Contributed by AV, 22-Jul-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm mat1comp(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wceq(co(c0, c3, c2), cif(c4, c5, wceq(c0, c2))))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(cbs, c7))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c7, crg))
  -| wceq(c4, cfv(cur, c7))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(c0g, c7))
  -| wceq(c3, cmpo(s0, s1, c1, c1, cif(c4, c5, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cfn))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c6)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wceq(co(c0, c3, c2), cif(c4, c5, wceq(c0, c2)))), wceq(c6, cfv(cbs, c7)))
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wceq(co(c0, c3, c2), cif(c4, c5, wceq(c0, c2)))), wi(w0, wcel(c7, crg)))
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wceq(co(c0, c3, c2), cif(c4, c5, wceq(c0, c2)))), wi(w0, wcel(c1, cfn)))
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wceq(co(c0, c3, c2), cif(c4, c5, wceq(c0, c2)))), diffsc(s0, c6))
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wceq(co(c0, c3, c2), cif(c4, c5, wceq(c0, c2)))), diffsc(s1, c6))
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wceq(co(c0, c3, c2), cif(c4, c5, wceq(c0, c2)))), diffsw(s0, w0))
  a1ii(wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c1)), wceq(co(c0, c3, c2), cif(c4, c5, wceq(c0, c2)))), diffsw(s1, w0))
  ovmpt2(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c1, c3, cif(c4, c5, wceq(c0, c2)), cif(c4, c5, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), cif(c4, c5, wceq(c0, cv(s1))))
  ifbid(c4, c5, wceq(cv(s0), c0), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(c0, cv(s1)))
  eqeq1(cv(s0), c0, cv(s1))
  ifbid(c4, c5, wceq(cv(s1), c2), wceq(c0, cv(s1)), wceq(c0, c2))
  eqeq2(cv(s1), c2, c0)
  ifex(c4, c5, wceq(c0, c2))
  fvexi(c4, cur, c7)
  fvexi(c5, c0g, c7)
  diff.cif.s(s0, c4, c5, wceq(c0, c2))
  diff.wceq.s(s0, c0, c2)
  diff.cif.s(s1, c4, c5, wceq(c0, c2))
  diff.wceq.s(s1, c0, c2)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm mat1comp(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚Üí(c0[c3]c2)= if(c0 = c2, c4, c5))
  ‚ä£ c6 =(Base ` c7)
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c7 ‚àà Ring)
  ‚ä£ c4 =(1r ` c7)
  ‚ä£ c5 =(0 ` c7)
  ‚ä£ c3 =(s0 ‚àà c1, s1 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶ if(s0 = s1, c4, c5))
  ‚ä£ (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà Fin)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c6)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c5)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚Üí(c0[c3]c2)= if(c0 = c2, c4, c5)), c6 =(Base ` c7))
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚Üí(c0[c3]c2)= if(c0 = c2, c4, c5)), (w0 ‚Üí c7 ‚àà Ring))
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚Üí(c0[c3]c2)= if(c0 = c2, c4, c5)), (w0 ‚Üí c1 ‚àà Fin))
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚Üí(c0[c3]c2)= if(c0 = c2, c4, c5)), d(s0, c6))
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚Üí(c0[c3]c2)= if(c0 = c2, c4, c5)), d(s1, c6))
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚Üí(c0[c3]c2)= if(c0 = c2, c4, c5)), d(s0, w0))
  a1ii(((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 ‚àà c1)‚Üí(c0[c3]c2)= if(c0 = c2, c4, c5)), d(s1, w0))
  ovmpt2(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c1, c3, if(c0 = c2, c4, c5), if(s0 = s1, c4, c5), if(c0 = s1, c4, c5))
  ifbid(c4, c5, s0 = c0, s0 = s1, c0 = s1)
  eqeq1(s0, c0, s1)
  ifbid(c4, c5, s1 = c2, c0 = s1, c0 = c2)
  eqeq2(s1, c2, c0)
  ifex(c4, c5, c0 = c2)
  fvexi(c4, cur, c7)
  fvexi(c5, c0g, c7)
  diff.cif.s(s0, c4, c5, c0 = c2)
  diff.wceq.s(s0, c0, c2)
  diff.cif.s(s1, c4, c5, c0 = c2)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, c0, c2)
}

blocks.name: mamulid
blocks.content: The identity matrix (as operation in maps-to notation) is a left identity (for any matrix with the same number of rows). (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 3-Sep-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 22-Jul-2019.)
blocks.origin:
thm mamulid(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wceq(co(c0, c1, c2), c2))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c4))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c4, crg))
  -| wceq(c5, cfv(cur, c4))
  -| wceq(c6, cfv(c0g, c4))
  -| wceq(c0, cmpo(s0, s1, c7, c7, cif(c5, c6, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c7, cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c8, cfn))
  -| wceq(c1, co(c4, cmmul, cotp(c7, c7, c8)))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, co(c3, cmap, cxp(c7, c8))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s0, c7)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsc(s1, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c7)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, wceq(co(c0, c1, c2), c2), wral(hs0, c7, wral(hs1, c8, wceq(co(cv(hs0), co(c0, c1, c2), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs0), c2, cv(hs1))))))
  ralrimivva(hs0, hs1, c7, c8, w0, wceq(co(cv(hs0), co(c0, c1, c2), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs0), c2, cv(hs1))))
  3eqtrd(co(cv(hs0), co(c0, c1, c2), cv(hs1)), co(cv(hs0), c2, cv(hs1)), co(c4, cgsu, cmpt(hs2, c7, co(co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2)), cfv(cmulr, c4), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1))))), cfv(cmpt(hs2, c7, co(co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2)), cfv(cmulr, c4), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1)))), cv(hs0)), wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wcel(cv(hs1), c8))))
  mamufv(hs2, cv(hs0), c0, c1, c2, cv(hs1), c4, c7, cfv(cmulr, c4), c7, c8, c3, crg, wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wcel(cv(hs1), c8))))
  adantr(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wcel(cv(hs1), c8)), wcel(c8, cfn))
  adantr(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wcel(cv(hs1), c8)), wcel(c0, co(c3, cmap, cxp(c7, c7))))
  adantr(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wcel(cv(hs1), c8)), wcel(c2, co(c3, cmap, cxp(c7, c8))))
  simprr(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wcel(cv(hs1), c8))
  gsumpt(c4, cmpt(hs2, c7, co(co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2)), cfv(cmulr, c4), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1)))), cv(hs0), c3, c6, c7, cfn, wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wcel(cv(hs1), c8))))
  syl(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wcel(cv(hs1), c8))), wcel(c4, cmnd), wcel(c4, crg))
  ringmnd(c4)
  simprl(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wcel(cv(hs1), c8))
  fmpttd(hs2, c7, co(co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2)), cfv(cmulr, c4), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1))), c3, wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wcel(cv(hs1), c8))))
  syl3anc(wa(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wcel(cv(hs1), c8))), wcel(cv(hs2), c7)), wcel(co(co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2)), cfv(cmulr, c4), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1))), c3), wcel(c4, crg), wcel(co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2)), c3), wcel(co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1)), c3))
  fovrnd(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2), c3, c7, c7, wa(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wcel(cv(hs1), c8))), wcel(cv(hs2), c7)))
  ad2antrr(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wcel(cv(hs1), c8)), wcel(cv(hs2), c7), wf(c0, cxp(c7, c7), c3))
  syl(w0, wf(c0, cxp(c7, c7), c3), wcel(c0, co(c3, cmap, cxp(c7, c7))))
  elmapi(c0, c3, cxp(c7, c7))
  ringcl(c4, co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2)), c3, co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1)), cfv(cmulr, c4))
  suppsssn(hs2, c7, co(co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2)), cfv(cmulr, c4), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1))), c6, cv(hs0), cfn, wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wcel(cv(hs1), c8))))
  eqtrd(co(co(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2)), cfv(cmulr, c4), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1))), c6, co(c6, cfv(cmulr, c4), co(cv(hs2), c2, cv(hs1))), w3a(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c7), wcel(cv(hs1), c8))), wcel(cv(hs2), c7), wne(cv(hs2), cv(hs0))))

blocks.name: mamurid
blocks.content: The identity matrix (as operation in maps-to notation) is a right identity (for any matrix with the same number of columns). (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 3-Sep-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 22-Jul-2019.)

thm mamurid(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, class c8, wff w0) {

  ‚ä£ d(s0, c6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c7)

  ‚ä£ d(s1, c5)

  ‚ä£ d(s1, c7)

  ‚ä£ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, (c0[c1]c2)= c0, ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c8, ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c7,(hs0[(c0[c1]c2)]hs1)=(hs0[c0]hs1))))
  ralrimivva(hs0, hs1, c8, c7, w0, (hs0[(c0[c1]c2)]hs1)=(hs0[c0]hs1))
  3eqtrd((hs0[(c0[c1]c2)]hs1), (hs0[c0]hs1), (c4[gsum](hs2 ‚àà c7 ‚Ü¶((hs0[c0]hs2)[(√ó ` c4)](hs2[c2]hs1)))), ((hs2 ‚àà c7 ‚Ü¶((hs0[c0]hs2)[(√ó ` c4)](hs2[c2]hs1)))` hs1), (w0 ‚àß(hs0 ‚àà c8 ‚àß hs1 ‚àà c7)))
  mamufv(hs2, hs0, c0, c1, c2, hs1, c4, c7, (√ó ` c4), c8, c7, c3, crg, (w0 ‚àß(hs0 ‚àà c8 ‚àß hs1 ‚àà c7)))

  simprl(w0, hs0 ‚àà c8, hs1 ‚àà c7)
  gsumpt(c4, (hs2 ‚àà c7 ‚Ü¶((hs0[c0]hs2)[(√ó ` c4)](hs2[c2]hs1))), hs1, c3, c6, c7, cfn, (w0 ‚àß(hs0 ‚àà c8 ‚àß hs1 ‚àà c7)))
  syl((w0 ‚àß(hs0 ‚àà c8 ‚àß hs1 ‚àà c7)), c4 ‚àà Mnd, c4 ‚àà Ring)
  ringmnd(c4)

blocks.name: matring
blocks.content: Existence of the matrix ring, see also the statement in [Lang] p. 504: "For a given integer n > 0 the set of square n x n matrices form a ring." (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 5-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: matassa
blocks.content: Existence of the matrix algebra, see also the statement in [Lang] p. 505: "Then Mat_n(R) is an algebra over R" . (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 5-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: mat1
blocks.content: Value of an identity matrix, see also the statement in [Lang] p. 504: "The unit element of the ring of n x n matrices is the matrix I_n ... whose components are equal to 0 except on the diagonal, in which case they are equal to 1.". (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 7-Sep-2015.)

blocks.name: oftpos
blocks.content: The transposition of the value of a function operation for two functions is the value of the function operation for the two functions transposed. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 17-Jul-2018.)

blocks.name: mattposcl
blocks.content: The transpose of a square matrix is a square matrix of the same size. (Contributed by SO, 9-Jul-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm mattposcl(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(ctpos(c0), c1))
  -| wceq(c2, co(c3, cmat, c4))
  -| wceq(c1, cfv(cbs, c2))
} = {
  eleqtrd(ctpos(c0), c1, co(cfv(cbs, c4), cmap, cxp(c3, c3)), wcel(c0, c1))
  mpbird(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(ctpos(c0), co(cfv(cbs, c4), cmap, cxp(c3, c3))), wf(ctpos(c0), cxp(c3, c3), cfv(cbs, c4)))
  3syl(wcel(c0, c1), wf(ctpos(c0), cxp(c3, c3), cfv(cbs, c4)), wcel(c0, co(cfv(cbs, c4), cmap, cxp(c3, c3))), wf(c0, cxp(c3, c3), cfv(cbs, c4)))
  matbas2i(c0, c1, cfv(cbs, c4), c3, c2, c4)
  elmapi(c0, cfv(cbs, c4), cxp(c3, c3))
  tposf(c0, c3, c3, cfv(cbs, c4))
  sylancr(wcel(c0, c1), wb(wcel(ctpos(c0), co(cfv(cbs, c4), cmap, cxp(c3, c3))), wf(ctpos(c0), cxp(c3, c3), cfv(cbs, c4))), wcel(cfv(cbs, c4), universe), wcel(cxp(c3, c3), cfn))
  fvex(cbs, c4)
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cxp(c3, c3), cfn), wcel(c3, cfn))
  simpld(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c3, cfn), wcel(c4, universe))
  anidms(wcel(c3, cfn), wcel(cxp(c3, c3), cfn))
  xpfi(c3, c3)
  elmapg(cfv(cbs, c4), universe, cxp(c3, c3), cfn, ctpos(c0))
  syl6eqr(co(cfv(cbs, c4), cmap, cxp(c3, c3)), c1, cfv(cbs, c2), wcel(c0, c1))
  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(co(cfv(cbs, c4), cmap, cxp(c3, c3)), cfv(cbs, c2)), wa(wcel(c3, cfn), wcel(c4, universe)))
  matrcl(c0, c1, c3, c4, c2)
  matbas2(c3, c4, universe, cfv(cbs, c4), c2)
  eqid(cfv(cbs, c4))
}

blocks.name: mattpostpos
blocks.content: The transpose of the transpose of a square matrix is the square matrix itself. (Contributed by SO, 17-Jul-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm mattpostpos(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wceq(ctpos(ctpos(c0)), c0))

  syl(wcel(c0, c1), wrel(c0), wf(c0, cxp(c3, c3), cfv(cbs, c4)))
  frel(c0, cxp(c3, c3), cfv(cbs, c4))

  relxp(c3, c3)
  releqd(cdm(c0), cxp(c3, c3), wcel(c0, c1))
  fdmd(c0, cxp(c3, c3), cfv(cbs, c4), wcel(c0, c1))

  matbas2i(c0, c1, cfv(cbs, c4), c3, c2, c4)

blocks.name: mattposvs
blocks.content: The transposition of a matrix multiplied with a scalar equals the transposed matrix multiplied with the scalar, see also the statement in [Lang] p. 505. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 17-Jul-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm mattposvs(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7) {

  mpancom(wcel(c2, c3), wceq(ctpos(co(cxp(cxp(c6, c6), csn(c0)), cof(cfv(cmulr, c7)), c2)), co(ctpos(cxp(cxp(c6, c6), csn(c0))), cof(cfv(cmulr, c7)), ctpos(c2))), wcel(cxp(cxp(c6, c6), csn(c0)), universe))
  sylancl(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(cxp(cxp(c6, c6), csn(c0)), universe), wcel(cxp(c6, c6), universe), wcel(csn(c0), universe))
  syl(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(cxp(c6, c6), universe), wcel(c6, cfn))
  simpld(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c6, cfn), wcel(c7, universe))

  snex(c0)

  oftpos(cxp(cxp(c6, c6), csn(c0)), universe, c2, c3, cfv(cmulr, c7))
  oveq1i(ctpos(cxp(cxp(c6, c6), csn(c0))), cof(cfv(cmulr, c7)), ctpos(c2), cxp(cxp(c6, c6), csn(c0)))
  tposconst(c6, c6, c0)
  tposeqd(co(c0, c4, c2), co(cxp(cxp(c6, c6), csn(c0)), cof(cfv(cmulr, c7)), c2), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)))
  matvsca2(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, cxp(c6, c6), cfv(cmulr, c7), c5, c6, c7)
  sylan2(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(co(c0, c4, ctpos(c2)), co(cxp(cxp(c6, c6), csn(c0)), cof(cfv(cmulr, c7)), ctpos(c2))), wcel(ctpos(c2), c3))
  mattposcl(c2, c3, c5, c6, c7)
  matvsca2(c0, c1, ctpos(c2), c3, c4, cxp(c6, c6), cfv(cmulr, c7), c5, c6, c7)

thm mattpos1(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  tposeqd(cfv(cur, c3), cmpo(hs0, hs1, c0, c0, cif(cfv(cur, c1), cfv(c0g, c1), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))), wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)))
  mat1(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, c3, cfv(cur, c1), cfv(c0g, c1))
  syl6eq(cfv(cur, c3), cmpo(hs1, hs0, c0, c0, cif(cfv(cur, c1), cfv(c0g, c1), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))), cmpo(hs1, hs0, c0, c0, cif(cfv(cur, c1), cfv(c0g, c1), wceq(cv(hs1), cv(hs0)))), wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, crg)))

  equcom(hs1, hs0)

blocks.name: tposmap
blocks.content: The transposition of an I X J -matrix is a J X I -matrix, see also the statement in [Lang] p. 505. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 9-Jul-2018.)

thm tposmap(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, cxp(c2, c3))), wcel(ctpos(c0), co(c1, cmap, cxp(c3, c2))))
} = {
  mpbird(wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, cxp(c2, c3))), wcel(ctpos(c0), co(c1, cmap, cxp(c3, c2))), wf(ctpos(c0), cxp(c3, c2), c1))

  elmapi(c0, c1, cxp(c2, c3))
  tposf(c0, c2, c3, c1)
  3syl(wcel(c0, co(c1, cmap, cxp(c2, c3))), wb(wcel(ctpos(c0), co(c1, cmap, cxp(c3, c2))), wf(ctpos(c0), cxp(c3, c2), c1)), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(cxp(c2, c3), universe)), wa(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(cxp(c3, c2), universe)))
  elmapex(c0, c1, cxp(c2, c3))
  anim2i(wcel(c1, universe), wcel(cxp(c2, c3), universe), wcel(cxp(c3, c2), universe))
  syl5eqelr(cxp(c3, c2), universe, ccnv(cxp(c2, c3)), wcel(cxp(c2, c3), universe))
  cnvxp(c2, c3)
  cnvexg(cxp(c2, c3), universe)
  elmapg(c1, universe, cxp(c3, c2), universe, ctpos(c0))
}
